messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Major, masters, professorship...
messages.msgSnippet: I don t have any formal education I just like to discuss/read/learn about anything japanese... and that does include anime. dnastaj  wrote:A
messages.messageBody:
I don't have any formal education I just like to discuss/read/learn about anything japanese... and that does include anime.

dnastaj <dnastaj@...> wrote:A new poster's question. Does anyone who frequents this discussion
group have any formal experience in the field of historical japan? Or
are the majority just people of appreciation?

Either way is cool to me. I just find the vast range of the knowledge
of you all extremely remarkable. It's very inspiring to read this
discussion board.

Oh, and, Hello.

;)

- DNastaj

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Major, masters, professorship...
messages.msgSnippet: Most of us are amateurs who read a lot. Tony Bryant (A.J. Bryant) is a published author on the subject and is currently working on yet another degree at IU;
messages.messageBody:
Most of us are amateurs who read a lot. Tony Bryant
(A.J. Bryant) is a published author on the subject and
is currently working on yet another degree at IU; he's
probably the most academic of us all, by far.

messages.subject: Re: Major, masters, professorship...
messages.msgSnippet: I myself have no formal education in Japanese history, I just read and research Japanese history because I find it extremely interesting. I ve read a few
messages.messageBody:
I myself have no "formal" education in Japanese history, I just read
and research Japanese history because I find it extremely
interesting. I've read a few books on Japanese history and I'm
constantly searching the internet for facts. Just recently I've
found this group, which has acted as both a source of knowledge, and
an outlet to express my knowledge.

And Hello back

--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "dnastaj" <dnastaj@y...>
wrote:
> A new poster's question. Does anyone who frequents this discussion
> group have any formal experience in the field of historical japan?
Or
> are the majority just people of appreciation?
>
> Either way is cool to me. I just find the vast range of the
knowledge
> of you all extremely remarkable. It's very inspiring to read this
> discussion board.
>
> Oh, and, Hello.

> ;)
>
> - DNastaj

messages.messageBody:
A new poster's question. Does anyone who frequents this discussion
group have any formal experience in the field of historical japan? Or
are the majority just people of appreciation?

Either way is cool to me. I just find the vast range of the knowledge
of you all extremely remarkable. It's very inspiring to read this
discussion board.

Oh, and, Hello.

;)

- DNastaj
